title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1218/90 of 8 May 1990 concerning the stopping of fishing for mackerel by vessels flying the flag of Spain
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1218/90
of 8 May 1990
concerning the stopping of fishing for mackerel by vessels flying the flag of Spain
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Catches of mackerel in the waters of ICES divisions II (excluding EC zone), V b (EC zone), VI, VII, VIII a, b, d and e, XII and XIV by vessels flying the flag of Spain or registered in Spain are deemed to have exhausted the quota allocated to Spain for 1990.
Fishing for mackerel in the waters of ICES divisions II (excluding EC zone), V b (EC zone), VI, VII, VIII a, b, d and e, XII and XIV by vessels flying the flag of Spain or registered in Spain is prohibited, as well as the retention on board, the transhipment and the landing of such stock captured by the abovementioned vessels after the date of application of this Regulation.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
It shall apply with effect from 27 April 1990.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
